186010738.review:
Portal ist ohne Frage eines der innovativsten und unterhaltsamsten Spiele, die ich je gespielt habe. Es kombiniert cleveres Rätseldesign mit einer einzigartigen Spielmechanik und einer herrlich düsteren Atmosphäre, die es zu einem absoluten Klassiker macht. Die Mischung aus cleveren Denksportaufgaben und humorvollem Storytelling sorgt für eine ganz besondere Spielerfahrung, die sowohl herausfordernd als auch unterhaltsam ist.

Das Spielprinzip ist so einfach wie genial: Du steuerst einen Charakter durch verschiedene Testkammern, in denen du mithilfe einer sogenannten „Portal-Gun“ zwei Portale erschaffst, die es dir ermöglichen, durch die Räume zu reisen und Rätsel zu lösen. Es klingt einfach, aber das Spiel stellt dir immer wieder neue, kreative Herausforderungen, die dein Gehirn auf Trab halten. Die Möglichkeiten, die sich durch das Setzen der Portale eröffnen, sind nahezu grenzenlos und bieten eine unglaublich befriedigende Mischung aus Logik und Kreativität.

Die Level sind durchdacht und entwickeln sich stetig weiter, sodass du dich immer weiter steigern kannst, ohne dass das Spiel zu einfach oder zu frustrierend wird. Es gibt stets neue Mechaniken und Ideen, die nach und nach eingeführt werden, was das Spiel frisch und spannend hält, ohne dabei die grundlegende Spielweise zu überladen.

Ein weiterer Höhepunkt von Portal ist der Humor. Die künstliche Intelligenz GLaDOS, die dich während des Spiels begleitet, ist ein wahres Meisterwerk der Spielewelt. Ihre sarkastischen Bemerkungen und ihr trockener Humor sorgen für immer wiederkehrende Lacher und machen die düstere Atmosphäre des Spiels gleichzeitig charmant und einzigartig.

Die Grafik ist im minimalistischen Stil gehalten, was perfekt zur Atmosphäre des Spiels passt und die eigentlichen Rätsel und das Gameplay in den Vordergrund stellt. Es gibt keine unnötigen Ablenkungen – das Spiel konzentriert sich voll und ganz auf das Erlebnis, das es bieten möchte.

Kurz gesagt: Portal ist ein absolutes Meisterwerk, das sowohl mit seiner innovativen Spielmechanik als auch mit seinem Humor begeistert. Es ist ein Spiel, das clever und herausfordernd ist, aber immer mit einer Leichtigkeit und Kreativität, die es zu einem unverwechselbaren Erlebnis machen. Ein absolutes Muss für alle, die Rätselspiele, kreative Lösungsansätze und großartigen Humor zu schätzen wissen!

186009988.review:
РЕЗУЛЬТАТЫ ТЕСТОВ ПОКАЗАЛИ ОТЗЫВ НА ИГРУ Portal.

Сюжет

Сюжет Portal, хотя и имеет свои интересные моменты, выглядит довольно слабым и неполным. Основная идея с тестированием в лаборатории и взаимодействием с ИИ, Гладос, не раскрыта в полной мере, и многие моменты остаются неясными. Отсутствие глубины в развитии персонажей и мотивации оставляет желать лучшего.

Геймплей

Геймплей игры может показаться оригинальным, но со временем становится однообразным. Хотя механика порталов интересна, уровень сложности не всегда оправдан, а некоторые головоломки вызывают больше раздражения, чем удовольствие. Кроме того, отсутствие разнообразия в задачах приводит к быстрому скучанию.

Визуал

Визуальный стиль Portal устарел и выглядит довольно примитивно по сравнению с современными играми. Простые текстуры и минималистичный дизайн уровней могут не впечатлить игроков, привыкших к более высоким стандартам графики.

Рекомендации

Покупать Portal стоит только для того, чтобы ознакомиться с сюжетом и понять контекст для Portal 2. Однако, если вы хотите получить полноценный игровой опыт, лучше сразу приобрести Portal 2, а сюжет первой части можно посмотреть в интернете.

Играбельно в 2025?
 
В 2025 году игра не совсем играбельна. Хотя некоторые элементы все еще могут быть интересны, общая устарелость механик и визуала сделает ее менее привлекательной для новых игроков.

Общая оценка

7/10. Игра имеет свои плюсы, но множество недостатков, которые затмевают положительные аспекты.

186006567.review:
Revisited both Portals after a decade, and was pleasantly reminded of how fun and intuitive these games are.

Portal 1 definitely has its feel of being an older game, with small glitches and visual mishaps, however, none of these take away from the fun and story telling.

Whilst the story is very short, it's still just as charming as it always has been, with great voice acting and quirky puzzles.

The actual game, whilst it loses a little bit of replayability after you know the puzzles, still remains one of the most intuitive and fun games I have played.

I look forward to playing this again in another 10 years.

185926688.review:
(This is a review of someone who hasn't seen anything about Portal 1 and 2 prior to playing)

[h1] Portal 1 - 8.8/10 [/h1]

[h2] Gameplay - 9.5 [/h2]
[b] + [/b] It's such a simple concept: two portals go nyoom, you teleport stuff, and that's it, but this mechanic has been heavily utilized by the game, making it really enjoyable (Better to build a game around a simple concept than to make a lot of mechanics that clutters gameplay).
[b] + [/b] Puzzles were really fun to solve.

[h2] Visuals - 8.0 [/h2]
[b] + [/b] I'm a little biased towards Source graphics.
[b] + [/b] Very brutalist.

[h2] Story - 7.5 [/h2]
[b] * [/b] As someone who hasn't been spoiled of Portal 1 or 2 (yes I have been living under a rock), the story was fine. There were definitely hints throughout the game that there is way more to this than I initially thought, but in my blind playthrough, I'd say the story was okay. 
[b] + [/b] I did like GlaDOS' dialogues a lot.

[h2] Audio - 9.0 [/h2]
[b] + [/b] Still Alive is an absolute banger.
[b] + [/b] The ambience of the game actually did creep me out (I'm very much scared of ambient horror).
[b] + [/b] GLaDOS' voice actress did a phenomenal job at voicing her.
[b] + [/b] The turrets are cute.
 
[h2] Value - 10 [/h2]
[b] + [/b] It's like less than a dollar when it goes on discount.
[b] + [/b] The bundle price is great too.
[b] + [/b] Play time is around ~2 hours.

185823983.review:
Portal is an amazing puzzle game that’s super unique and really makes you think. You play as a test subject in a mysterious lab controlled by an AI named GLaDOS, who guides (and sometimes mocks) you while you solve puzzles. The main tool in the game is the portal gun, which lets you create two connected portals. You use this to get through obstacles, reach higher places, or move objects around.  

The puzzles start off simple so you can learn how everything works, but they get more challenging as you go. You have to think creatively and sometimes try different strategies to figure them out. It’s really satisfying when you solve a tough puzzle!  

The story is also really cool, with a mix of humor and mystery. GLaDOS has some funny but also creepy moments, which keeps the game exciting and interesting. Even though the game isn’t very long, it feels just right because the puzzles and story are so well done.  

If you like games where you have to use your brain and enjoy something a bit different, Portal is definitely worth playing. It’s a classic that still holds up, and once you finish it, you’ll probably want to try the second game too!

185730038.review:
A simple but brilliant single-player experience, demonstrating exemplary game design that is nothing short of the genius concept involving making portals to progress through increasingly difficult and hazardous levels. 

This game is extremely accessible to players of all ages and just about anyone can get hooked with this game's easy-to-understand mechanics and genuinely smart puzzles. The player is required to have an understanding of the basic physics system and is often demanded to think out-of-the-box for some of the smarter puzzles. 

By solving these increasingly challenging puzzles, the player is not only rewarded with some amusing dialogues, but also with one of the most memorable endings of any video game ever. While the game is quite short, it never overstays its welcome, maintaining brilliant pacing through-and-through and lasting just long enough to leave a solid impression.

Portal is really one of [i]those[/i] games, and is clearly one of the greatest puzzle games ever made.

185628388.review:
A Brilliant Puzzle Masterpiece...
Portal is a masterclass in game design, blending mind-bending puzzles with dark humor and minimalist storytelling. 
Armed with the iconic portal gun, players navigate cleverly designed test chambers while unraveling the secrets of Aperture Science.
GLaDOS, the sinister yet hilariously passive-aggressive AI, steals the show, delivering unforgettable lines as you delve deeper into the facility. 
The puzzles are ingeniously crafted, encouraging creativity and rewarding "aha!" moments without ever feeling unfair.
Though brief, Portal’s tight pacing and unique charm make it an unforgettable experience. 
A perfect blend of wit, innovation, and gameplay.
Still alive and still a must-play.

185620866.review:
You ever love a game a much that you wish you could play it for the first time again?
This is one of those games.

I absolutely adore Portal, it is a perfect game in my eyes.
The gameplay is pretty straight forward, use portals to solve puzzles but it really tests your brain in a fun way. A really cool thing about this game is that there are multiple ways of going about solving each puzzle which allows for more player freedom and makes repeat playthroughs more fun because you might find a new way to solve a puzzle.

If you're looking for more of a challenge after the main game then I highly recommend playing the advanced/challenge maps. These will REALLY test you, I was stuck on some of them for what felt like hours but once you beat them it's incredibly satisfying and you'll learn some new neat tricks.

The atmosphere is great, it really feels kind of backrooms-esque especially when you stumble into well.. the backrooms of the lab. It's just you, GLaDOS (she is amazing btw), and the lab which really makes you feel isolated. There isn't too much of a story but what is there is really thought provoking and interesting.

If you haven't played this game yet then you're seriously missing out.
     It's short and sweet
     It can run on pretty much anything
     It doesn't take a lot of space
     It's cheap
So do yourself a favor and get this game, trust me you won't regret it :)

185495079.review:
传送门是一款 V 社开发的第一人称解谜游戏，关卡设计非常有意思，虽然玩的时候时常摸不着头脑或者找不到路，但是趟过那一关以后就会豁然开朗。可以感觉到开发者的用心。

缺点就是容易晕 3D 哈哈哈，有些地方的视角眩晕感贼严重。晕 3D 的小伙伴慎入

[hr][/hr]
（全成就后评价）

太开心了，断断续续打了将近一个星期，终于全成就了。一改之前的评价（什么逆天游戏设计）：

传送门关卡设计缜密，挑战关卡相当具有挑战性，[b]在精打细算、步步为营存档，历经种种逆天关卡设计折磨之后满足条件通关，仿佛拨开迷雾见明月，柳暗花明又一村，登科及第，任何言语难以形容内心的得意。昔日龌龊不足夸，今朝放荡思无涯。春风得意马蹄疾，一日看尽长安花。[/b]

分享一下心得：

首先，全成就是非常难的，看成就比例也能看出来，在做之前要有坚定的信念，不要半途而废。建议上B站跟教程做，你会发现其实有很多很多巧妙、甚至可以称得上是“歪门邪道”的方法来提升你的通关速度，自己摸索特别费时间而且摸不着头脑。

其次，说一下需要注意的点（！有剧透慎看！）：

[spoiler]折磨点1：打掉全部摄像头的成就，和收音机的成就。需要你重打一遍二周目，打掉每一个可以打掉的摄像头（有的摄像头背后是金属墙没法打），然后将收音机拿到对应的位置去激活（红变绿）。特别特别需要注意的就是勤存档，别到时候错过了空悲切。我就是错过了又忘记存档，重进了三遍

折磨点2：传送门高级关卡和挑战关卡。高级关卡没什么难的，有手就行。特别难得是传送门挑战关卡。分三种：限时间，限距离，限传送门数。

其中，我个人认为难度排名是：限时间 > 限距离 > 限传送门数，后两者很简单，跟着视频慢慢来就好。限传送门的数量属于是喂到嘴里吃饭，不需要你有任何反应速度和细节把控。限制距离就需要多琢磨一下，多存档，思考有没有更好的解法和路径。限时间是最难的，前两个属于是开卷答题，限时间属于是开卷了你也不会做，需要极强的反应能力和清晰的思路，也建议多存存档，不要害怕试错。

推荐两个攻略：

https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1L6421w7bY
https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1FqqDY3E58
[/spoiler]

祝有全成就想法的朋友们早日全成就！

185479606.review:
Portal" isn’t just a game it’s an experience. You start off thinking, “Oh, this is just a cool little puzzle game,” but before you know it, you’re hooked by the clever level design, mind bending mechanics, and one of the best (and funniest) AI villains in gaming history.

[h3]Gameplay[/h3]

The concept is simple: you’ve got a portal gun that lets you shoot two linked portals, and you use it to solve puzzles and escape from increasingly tricky test chambers. It’s one of those games that makes you feel super smart when you figure something out. The puzzles are challenging, but they never get frustrating, which is a tough balance to pull off.

[h3]Story & Humor[/h3]

At first, it seems like you’re just doing a series of science tests for some faceless company. Then you realize GLaDOS, the AI guiding you, is… a bit off. Her dark, deadpan humor keeps things interesting, and by the end, the story takes a pretty wild turn. Oh, and let’s not forget there’s cake! (Or is there?)

[h3]Soundtrack & Voice Acting[/h3]

The music is subtle but fits the game perfectly, and GLaDOS’s voice is unforgettable. Honestly, her snarky comments made me laugh more times than I can count. And if you stick around for the credits, you get treated to Still Alive, one of the catchiest ending songs ever.

[h3]Final Thoughts[/h3]

"Portal" might be short (a few hours long), but every second is brilliant. It’s fun, it’s clever, and it leaves a lasting impression. Whether you’re into puzzles or just want to play something unique, this game is totally worth it. Trust me, once you start thinking with portals, you’ll never look at walls the same way again.

185431223.review:
Quando acquistai portal anni fa, venni attirato da un elemento che non centra una mazza con le meccaniche di gioco: il fatto che fosse leggerissimo e girasse anche su un tostapane. Infatti prima delle macchine che ho ora, all'epoca utilizzavo un pc da ufficio per giocare, e quando lo finii su quel vecchio lenovo non lo rigiocai più, salvo per provare qualche mod, anche se contando come è supportato, alcune sono anche prodotti standalone non ufficiali. 
Che dire... io mi sono scoperto grande fan dei puzzle game grazie a portal, ma soprattutto mi sono scoperto grande fan di Valve! Io non sono mai stato un fan sfegatato delle avventure fps troppo lineari perché più cresco meno ho interesse nella rigiocare i giochi già conclusi, ma Portal mi ha stregato come poche cose al mondo: un gioco cinico, acuto, originale e unico nel suo modo di introdurti agli enigmi, grazie ad una scrittura divertente ma con un sottotono disturbante che mi ha fatto impazzire. Infatti io inserirei SOPRATTUTTO il primo portal, grazie alla sua ambientazione liminale che mi ricorda il moderno Control, the Stanley Parable (che hanno imparato da portal sia chiaro) oltre che per ovvi motivi Half Life 2, nella categoria dei thriller Psicologici, dove più scavi nell'iceberg più comprendi come quei laboratori hanno un sotto testo che, per quanto utile solo all'immedesimazione, ti fa venire quel brividino ogni volta che vedi scritto sul muro una frase come ''the cake is a Lie''. 
Per quanto il secondo capitolo sia sotto ogni punto di vista migliore, io consiglio caldamente di non sottovalutare il primo, perché, forse per il contesto più semplice porta un'atmosfera talmente stramba e freak, affiancata da enigmi ancora più fisici del secondo (essendo che il periodo storico aveva come novità principalmente la fisica), probabilmente tra i due preferisco proprio l'originale.

185292620.review:
Хорошая игра. Она не душная, проходится на одном дыхание за 2 часа. Озвучка крывоватая, такое чуство будто с тобой разговаривает не Гладос а Сири. Гемплей прикольный. Бегаешь по уровню, портальчик там портальчик тут и не заметишь что уровень уже пройден. Босс файт настолько легкий что даже грустно становится. После основной игры можно повыполнять достижение, а также открываются бонусные уровни. 1 это усложнённые камеры испытаний и 2 испытание на время, на шаги и на порталы. С первым все понятно А вот испытание и связанные с ним достижение это піздец. Очень потные и без гайда пройти почти невозможно, но когда их выполнишь такой кайф ловишь от того что ты это сделал, поставил раком эту игру. Не рекомендую прикасатся к испытаниям если вам жалко свои нервы. А так если никогда не играли в Портал то рекомендую, оно того стоит, и запомните "торт это лож"
10 порталов из 10

185280256.review:
AMAZING game, thank you valve for this original, inspiring and awesome game. just a steal for its price and just insane on sales. If you are thinking about buying this game, stop thinking and start buying.
The game has a very original UI and physics engine that it shares with its cool big brother - half life.
The graphics are okay but i recommend that if you have an rtx gpu you just play the rtx version (its completally free if portal is bought) and it does require an rtx gpu (even my 2050 can run it 20-30 fps 1080p min. settings).
It's insane how they created this mind blowing storyline in a sci-fi game that is all about a portal gun (i'm not going to spoil anything but please don't watch playthroughs  for this game it can ruin the surprises you'll find in the story).
This game is for the people that like a good puzzle every once in a while and want to challenge themselves. At first it doesn't look like much of a storyline but trust me, it's AWESOME SAUCE!!!
GET THIS GAME NOW!

Portal is one of those games that is so well-known in internet culture that I treated it as a bit of an afterthought. But recently I bought a couple valve classics on sale and decided I would sit down and actually play it. 

It's pretty simple, but the mechanics are so fun to mess around with and use to solve the puzzles. The story and world are engaging and it the way the second half incorporates everything you learned to navigate the levels feels rewarding. Glad I got it, and I am looking forward to playing the other Valve games I missed out on over the years.

185197307.review:
О игре Portal сказано уже очень много, поэтому я попробую рассказать об этой игре в двух словах. 
Игра 2007 года и если приглядеться, то можно увидеть, что текстуры уже не очень, но это абсолютно не важно. 
Игра обладает интересным сюжетом, который открывается нам благодаря прекрасной озвучке и множестве мелких моментов, которые можно увидеть по ходу игры. События происходят в одной вселенной с half-life, поэтому имеются отсылки.
У игры очень плавное управление, поэтому остальное зависит от вашей реакции.
Основная часть игры спокойно проходится за 2-3 часа спокойной игры, вместе с этим есть сложные дополнительные уровни, которые могут потребовать много времени.
Есть модификации улучшающие графику для тех кому она не нравится. Есть продолжение, что продолжает историю.
В целом эта игра произвела на меня большое впечатление. У создателей получилось создать погружающую атмосферу. Всем рекомендую! 
ВО ВРЕМЯ РАСПРОДАЖИ ЕЁ МОЖНО КУПИТЬ С ОЧЕНЬ БОЛЬШОЙ СКИДКОЙ.

185189061.review:
Portal est un véritable chef-d'œuvre de design de jeu, un classique instantané qui mélange réflexion, humour et innovation d'une manière que peu de jeux ont réussie à égaler. Malgré sa simplicité apparente, Portal est un jeu brillant qui vous défie à chaque étape, tout en vous offrant une expérience de jeu captivante et mémorable.

C'est l'un des jeux les plus créatifs et mémorables auxquels j'ai joué. Sa mécanique de portails unique, son gameplay stimulant, et son humour inoubliable en font un jeu à la fois simple à comprendre mais difficile à maîtriser. La courte durée et l’environnement répétitif peuvent être des points négatifs pour certains, mais ces défauts sont largement compensés par l'ingéniosité des puzzles et la narration captivante. Si vous n'avez pas encore joué à Portal, je vous recommande vivement de le faire — c’est un incontournable pour tous les amateurs de jeux de réflexion. Vous passerez un moment agréable et, en prime, vous serez conquis par l'humour et l'atmosphère unique qui font de ce jeu un classique.

185184245.review:
"Portal" — гениальная игра для тех, кто любит шутить с законами физики.
Вы думаете, что знаете, как работает мир? Попробуйте взглянуть на него через портальную пушку. Даже я, с моими способностями, был впечатлён.

Геймплей — как моя техника 'Безграничность': полный контроль над пространством, и врагам просто некуда деваться. 🌀

GLaDOS? Отличный антагонист! Её сарказм? Почти на моём уровне. Хотя, между нами говоря, она бы не справилась в прямом бою.

Загадки? Прекрасный вызов для ума, но не для такого гения, как я. 😏 Всё прошёл за пару часов, но удовольствие получил огромное.

11/10. "Portal" — это игра, которая показывает: даже простые стены могут стать воротами к чему-то большему. И да, торт действительно оказался ложью.

P.S. Valve, добавьте кооп-режим, чтобы я мог показать друзьям, как решать головоломки быстрее них. 😂"

185117535.review:
Here's how to make the cake

Ingredients:

1 2/3 cups all-purpose flour

1 1/2 cups granulated sugar

2/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder

1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda

1 teaspoon salt

1 1/2 cups buttermilk

1/2 cup vegetable shortening 

2 eggs

1 teaspoon vanilla extract

1/2 cup Kirsch (cherry liqueur)


For the filling:

¼ cup Kirsch

2 cans sour cherries

3 cups heavy whipping cream

¼ cup confectioners' sugar

3 tablespoons cocoa


For the Garnish:

1 semisweet chocolate bar, frozen

At least 8 maraschino cherries (no stems)

One white candle


Directions
1) Preheat your oven to 350°F.

2) Grease and flour two 8 inch cakepans, or line with parchment paper.

3) Sift together the flour, the cocoa, the baking soda and the salt. Set this aside.

4) Beat the shortening and sugar together until they are fluffy. Add the eggs an vanilla and beat thoroughly.

5) Slowly beat in the flour mixture, occasionally alternating with the buttermilk. Beat until combined.

6) Pour the batter into the cakepans.

7) Bake for about 35 or 40 minutes (or until a a fork or a wooden pick comes out clean when inserted into the cake. Let the cake cool completely. The cake will be easier to cut if you keep it in the fridge for a few hours before cutting.

8) After the cake has cooled, cut each layer in half (horizontally) to make four total layers. Sprinkle the layers with the 1/2 cup of Kirsch.

9) Drain the canned cherries in a colander to remove most of the juice.

10) Beat the whipping cream with confectioners' sugar until it thickens to desired texture.

11) Put a small amount of the cream/sugar mixture aside for garnish. Mix the cocoa powder into the remaining majority of the whipped cream frosting.

12) Place one cake layer on the serving dish you wish to use. Spread about one 6th of the whipped cream on the layer, and strew a third of the cherries on top of the whipped cream.

13) Add the second cake layer on top of the first. Spread one 6th of the whipped cream on the second layer and 1/3 of the cherries on top.

14) Add the third cake layer. Spread 1/6 of the whipped cream on that and add the remaining cherries.

15) Top with the last cake layer. Frost the top and sides of the cake with remaining frosting.

16) Use a potato peeler on the chocolate to create thin shaves. Gently pat the chocolate shaves on to the sides and top of the cake, completely coating it.

17) Use the whipped cream you set aside earlier to place eight small circles around the top of the cake. Place your non-stemmed maraschino cherries on each one.

18) Place white candle in the center and light. Congratulations, you have made the cake a reality

Apesar de ser um jogo antigo, gostei bastante dos puzzles e da história de fundo. É algo simples, mas bem feito, especialmente para o tempo que se dedica a ele.

Recomendo para quem gosta de puzzles rápidos e está em busca de algo leve e divertido para uma única sessão. Porém, vale lembrar que, uma vez que você resolve os puzzles, as respostas ficam gravadas na cabeça, o que pode tirar o fator surpresa em uma segunda jogada.

I had Portal on my Steam account for over a year and I never played it.

A lot of the levels are really hard, I couldn't complete the game without looking at walkthrough videos, I must admit that. The game is short, it doesn't have a high number of achievements and the storyline is not really clear. 
Yet, If you wish to spend some hours on a really fun and futuristic game – this one might suite you.

184877391.review:
🔫 Начало: "О, у меня есть портал-пушка! Это весело!"
🤯 Через час: "Куда мне встать, чтобы не улететь в бесконечность?!"
🎂 Мотивация: Где мой обещанный торт?!

Portal — это игра, которая учит, что физика бывает коварной, а искусственный интеллект с сарказмом — худший враг. Ты решаешь головоломки, прыгаешь через порталы и периодически задумываешься: "А это вообще законно?"

ГЛаДОС (тот самый ИИ) — это смесь гениального учёного и токсичного друга, который подкалывает тебя, пока ты мучаешься. Её фразы одновременно мотивируют и заставляют сомневаться в собственных жизненных решениях.

Стадии прохождения:

"Как же всё просто, это игра для детей!"
"Окей, надо подумать. Не так уж сложно."
"ЧТО ЭТО ЗА ЛАЗЕРНЫЙ ХАОС?!"
"Ну, хотя бы торт в конце меня порадует..." (спойлер: нет).
Главные выводы:
✔ Прыжки через порталы — лучшее кардио.
✔ Куб-компаньон — лучший друг, которого ты не заслуживаешь.
✔ Торт — это ложь, но сарказм ГЛаДОС — абсолютная правда.

Совет новичкам: Не думайте, что вы умнее этой игры. Она знает о вас всё и заставит пересмотреть ваши способности к пространственному мышлению.

Вывод:
Portal — это смесь комедии, драмы и физического эксперимента над вашей психикой. Это игра, где ум становится оружием, а сарказм — музыкой для ушей.

Оценка: 10/10. Хотел торт, получил экзистенциальный кризис, но ни о чём не жалею.

184858739.review:
"Торт, который мы заслужили"

Portal — это игра, которая одновременно заставит вас почувствовать себя гением и полным идиотом, всё за один уровень. Здесь нет огромных миров или эпичных битв, но есть холодные стены лаборатории Aperture Science, голос саркастичного ИИ и портальная пушка, которая перевернёт ваш мозг вверх дном.  

Суть проста: вы — тестовый объект. У вас есть портальная пушка, которая создаёт два портала. Один вход, другой выход. Всё. А теперь попробуйте выбраться из комнаты с ямой, платформой и лазером, который пытается вас поджарить. Не получается? Ничего страшного, GLaDOS тут, чтобы подколоть вас ещё раз.  

Игра идеально сочетает головоломки, черный юмор и атмосферу научного эксперимента, который явно пошёл не так. Каждый уровень — это как шахматная партия с физикой, где ходить приходится быстро, иначе вас поджарят турели.  

А финал? Это отдельное искусство. Сюжет крутится, как куб-компаньон в портале, оставляя вас с чувством, что торт был не просто ложью, а самой сладкой ложью в вашей жизни.  

Плюсы:
+ Гениальные головоломки.  
+ GLaDOS — лучший ИИ-злодей всех времён.  
+ Прекрасный баланс сложности и юмора.  

Минусы:
- Хотелось бы, чтобы игра длилась дольше.  
- После прохождения перестаёшь верить тортам.  

Если вы хотите размять мозги и при этом насладиться лучшим сарказмом в играх, Portal — это именно то, что вам нужно. И помните: торт — это ложь.

Cool, but there's no Portal that leads to Dark Souls 2, so its not worth it.

While Portal 1 excels in its design and creativity, there’s always a lingering thought: if only this game could somehow open a portal directly to the world of Dark Souls 2.

Dark Souls 2 is the true masterpiece, the second coming of Christ in the gaming world, offering a level of depth, challenge, and emotional engagement that Portal 1 simply can't match. While Portal 1 delivers entertaining puzzles, Dark Souls 2 presents a living, breathing world where every encounter demands mastery, every victory feels earned, and every loss serves as a lesson to be learned. The intricate world-building, relentless difficulty, and deeply rewarding combat system make Dark Souls 2 the ultimate gaming experience—one that challenges your mind, body, and spirit in a way that no puzzle platformer ever could. Dark Souls 2 is not just a game; it's a transformative journey that reshapes your approach to gaming and life itself. If Portal 1 is a clever diversion, Dark Souls 2 is a life-changing odyssey that elevates the very concept of what games can achieve.

184830082.review:
💥 Portal is a groundbreaking puzzle-platformer that redefined gaming with its innovative mechanics, clever humor, and unforgettable atmosphere. 💥

Developed by Valve, Portal places you in the role of Chell, a silent protagonist navigating the mysterious Aperture Science facility. Armed with the iconic Portal Gun, you create linked portals to solve puzzles, traverse obstacles, and uncover the facility’s dark secrets. The game's premise is deceptively simple, but its puzzles become increasingly complex and satisfying, challenging your spatial reasoning and creativity.

Guiding you through this journey is the game’s most iconic character, GLaDOS, an AI with a sinister undertone and a penchant for dark humor. Her witty and increasingly menacing commentary adds depth to the story, making her one of gaming’s most memorable antagonists.

Despite its relatively short length, Portal delivers an experience packed with brilliance. Its minimalistic design and tight pacing ensure there’s no filler, just pure, innovative gameplay that has stood the test of time.

Key Highlights:
-Portal Mechanics: Create mind-bending solutions using linked portals.
-Ingenious Level Design: Each chamber is crafted to challenge your problem-solving skills.
-Memorable Antagonist: GLaDOS’s dark humor and evolving role elevate the narrative.
-Physics-Based Gameplay: Innovative puzzles that reward experimentation and ingenuity.

Pros:
-Revolutionary gameplay mechanics that feel fresh even years later.
-A sharp, witty script with an unforgettable antagonist.
-Tight pacing with no wasted moments.
-Immersive atmosphere and subtle storytelling.

Cons:
-Short playtime (around 4–5 hours).
-Some puzzles might feel daunting for newcomers to the genre.

🎮 Portal is a masterpiece of design, humor, and innovation that remains a must-play for gamers of all types. Its blend of unique mechanics, engaging narrative, and intelligent humor set a new standard for what puzzle games could achieve. If you haven’t experienced the magic of Portal, it’s time to pick up the Portal Gun and jump into the test chambers.

🌟 9.5/10 🌟

Este es uno de los pilares más curiosos de la industria.

Nacido de un proyecto de universidad, Portal te da una sensación de soledad muy interesante. 
Explora un abanico de posibilidades muy curiosas. Casi infantiles hasta cierto punto me atrevería a decir.
Es al final el mero concepto de probar y probar lo que nos forja como individuos. Y Portal no es más que un grupo de desarrolladores probando y probando. Valve hizo algo grandioso aquí.

Y es cierto que prefiero su segunda entrega. Pero al César lo que es del César. 

Portal es historia de los videojuegos. Y eso, es innegable.

184579420.review:
[h3]Геймплей (22/30)[/h3]
Игра предлагает уникальную механику — портальную пушку, которая позволяет создавать точки A и B и перемещаться между ними. Эта механика является основой всего игрового процесса, что делает его оригинальным, но в то же время однообразным. Головоломки простые, но увлекательные, подходят как для новичков, так и для опытных игроков.

[h3]Сюжет и вовлечённость (12/20)[/h3]
Сюжет игры загадочен и интригует во время прохождения, однако он достаточно прямолинеен, без ярких поворотов. Игра оставляет положительные эмоции, но не вызывает сильного вовлечения после завершения.

[h3]Графика и дизайн (8/15)[/h3]
Для своего времени графика выглядит достойно, хотя по современным меркам она устарела. Лаборатории Aperture Science оформлены хорошо, но не предлагают уникальных деталей, которые могли бы выделяться.

[h3]Управление (9/10)[/h3]
Управление интуитивно понятное и приятное. Сложностей в освоении нет, что делает игру доступной для всех.

[h3]Музыка и звуковые эффекты (5/10)[/h3]
Музыка и звуковые эффекты помогают создать атмосферу, но не запоминаются. Саундтрек не играет значительной роли в общем впечатлении.

[h3]Реиграбельность (3/10)[/h3]
Желание перепроходить игру отсутствует. Головоломки не предоставляют альтернативных решений или вызовов для повторного прохождения.

[h3]Техническая реализация (5/5)[/h3]
Игра работает стабильно. Багов или технических проблем не было замечено.

[h3]Инновации (4/5)[/h3]
Portal представила уникальную механику портальной пушки, которая оказала влияние на жанр головоломок и игр с использованием физики.

[h3]Личная оценка (3/5)[/h3]
Игра оставила нейтральные эмоции. Пройти её было интересно, но ни одного момента, который действительно запомнился, не было.

[h3]Заключение[/h3]
Portal — это инновационная игра с уникальной механикой, достойным дизайном и простой, но увлекательной историей. Она идеально подходит для однократного прохождения, но реиграбельность и звуковое сопровождение оставляют желать лучшего. Рекомендуется для любителей головоломок и экспериментов с физикой.

[h3]Итоговая оценка: 71/100[/h3]

184575711.review:
[h1] This review contains no spoilers: [/h1]

Great game! The Gameplay was exciting every step of the way. The Graphics didn't age badly, even though they are a bit lackluster. I'm sure the graphics were great in 2007 though, so there's no problem with that. Sometimes it was tricky figuring out things in the last part of the game, but you just need to find another angle to look at it and you will persevere. All in one, I think it's great and it should definitely be played by everyone at one point. The original price of 20 euros/dollars is kind of harsh in my opinion, and you should wait a bit for a sale to start, since I got this, aswell as Portal 2 in a bundle for just 3 euros/dollars. Oh and about the portal gun: It was so amazing, like genuinely one of the coolest things in gaming history. The Portals were realistic and smooth to go through and it was really satisfying seeing you go through a portal and coming out another way far away and at a different angle. Just so trippy and awesome. The robotic voice which follows you around the entire game was also really funny at times, even unwillingly. I would rate this game a solid [b] 9/10 [/b].

184567237.review: This game is great. You play as Chell, an unwilling test subject, as you make your way through 19 test chambers. GLaDOS, a seemingly helpful guide, introduces you to the many hazardous obstacles encountered throughout the game. However, she reveals her true intention; she wants to kill you. You must find GLaDOS' central chamber and kill her. Very early in the game, you get a device, known as the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device, you can use to make your own portals. To complete the game, and kill GLaDOS, you must manipulate objects, including yourself, through portals. There are also some challenges for skilled players. Overall, even though this game is short in length, it's very fun, and it offers unique and challenging gameplay.

184543285.review:
Portal 1 is nothing short of a gaming masterpiece that has left an indelible mark on the puzzle-platformer genre. Released as part of the innovative game bundle “The Orange Box” in 2007, this gem has captivated players with its unique mechanics, clever design, and darkly humorous narrative. Here’s why Portal deserves every bit of praise it receives.

Innovative Gameplay Mechanics:
At the heart of Portal is the iconic Portal Gun, a device that allows players to create linked portals on flat surfaces. This simple yet revolutionary mechanic transforms the way players approach puzzles. The ability to teleport between two points opens up a world of creative problem-solving, encouraging experimentation and lateral thinking. Each test chamber presents a new challenge that requires players to think outside the box, making every victory feel earned and satisfying.

Clever Level Design:
The level design in Portal is nothing short of brilliant. Each chamber is meticulously crafted, gradually introducing new elements and mechanics that build upon one another. The progression feels natural, as players learn to master the Portal Gun while facing increasingly complex puzzles. The game strikes a perfect balance between challenge and accessibility, ensuring that players of all skill levels can enjoy the experience.

Engaging Story and Atmosphere:
Portal’s narrative is cleverly woven into the gameplay, with players taking on the role of Chell, a test subject navigating the Aperture Science facility. The story unfolds through subtle environmental storytelling and the chilling yet humorous guidance of GLaDOS, the facility’s AI. GLaDOS’s dry wit and ominous undertones create a unique atmosphere that keeps players engaged from start to finish. The combination of humor and suspense adds depth to the experience, making it more than just a series of puzzles.

Visuals and Sound Design:
Despite its age, Portal’s minimalist art style remains visually appealing. The clean, sterile environments of Aperture Science are both intriguing and unsettling, perfectly complementing the game’s themes. The sound design is equally impressive, with GLaDOS’s voice acting standing out as a highlight. The combination of ambient sounds and clever audio cues enhances the immersion, drawing players deeper into the game’s world.

Replayability and Community:
Portal’s compact length (around 2-4 hours for a first playthrough) encourages replayability. After completing the main story, players can return to tackle the game’s challenges with a new perspective or try their hand at speedrunning. Additionally, the game has inspired a vibrant community of fans who create custom maps and mods, ensuring that the Portal experience continues to evolve long after its initial release.

Conclusion:
Portal is a shining example of what video games can achieve when creativity and innovation come together. Its unique gameplay, engaging narrative, and clever design make it a must-play for anyone who enjoys puzzles or platformers. Whether you’re a seasoned gamer or new to the genre, Portal offers an unforgettable experience that will keep you thinking long after the credits roll. If you haven’t played it yet, do yourself a favor and dive into the mind-bending world of Aperture Science—you won’t regret it!

184443627.review:
玩了16小时后，我可以毫不犹豫地说，《传送门1》是一个值得推荐的经典游戏。初次接触时，它带来的新奇感让我深深着迷。游戏通过简单却极具创意的核心机制——传送枪，将解谜与物理学巧妙结合，每次打开传送门，都让我感到仿佛进入了一个全新的空间维度。这种设计令人耳目一新，不仅激发了玩家的探索欲，也让整个游戏过程充满惊喜。  

游戏的主线流程并不算长，但却足够紧凑且精妙。解谜设计从简单到复杂层层递进，每一关卡都充满挑战和趣味性。最让我印象深刻的是那些巧妙利用物理规律的谜题，比如利用惯性跳跃或者反弹光线的设计，不仅考验逻辑思维，还需要一定的手眼配合能力。而当我通关后解锁挑战地图时，才发现这款游戏真正的深度。  

挑战地图带来了更高的难度，它要求玩家用最少的步数、最短的时间或者最少的传送门完成关卡。在完成全部挑战地图后，我不仅对关卡设计的精细程度赞叹不已，也深刻体会到这款游戏对细节的追求。然而，游戏中金银铜牌的评判标准实在过于苛刻。即使在我已经反复练习的情况下，想要拿到金牌依然是难上加难。可以说，这些高难度的目标是为追求极限挑战的硬核玩家准备的，普通玩家可能需要更多耐心和毅力才能完成。  

总的来说，《传送门1》是一款几乎没有短板的游戏。它在剧情上简洁而引人入胜，解谜设计出类拔萃，游戏机制创新独特，同时还隐藏着不少令人捧腹的幽默感。即便时隔多年，这款游戏依然毫不过时，甚至在解谜类游戏中树立了标杆。  

对新手来说，它是一次值得体验的创新旅程；而对老玩家来说，挑战地图和完美成绩则提供了足够的深度和可玩性。如果你喜欢解谜类游戏，《传送门1》绝对是必玩的经典之作。

184434541.review:
[h1]Des portails, des casse-têtes et une IA qui vous veut du bien… enfin je crois ?[/h1]

Portal est un jeu qui a su marquer les esprits, et à juste titre. D'un concept simple : des portails interdimensionnels, il a créé une expérience de jeu inoubliable. Vous incarnez Chell, une experte en résolution de puzzles (ou pas, vu qu’on la suit dans une installation de test un peu douteuse), qui doit s’échapper d’un laboratoire rempli d’énigmes… et de pièges. Mais attention, pas n’importe quels pièges : des puzzles à résoudre à l’aide d’un gadget qui ouvre des portails. Pratique, non ? Le tout avec une dose de réflexion qui vous fera revenir à l'écran à plusieurs reprises. :P

L'originalité du jeu réside dans la mécanique des portails. C’est un vrai casse-tête mental de comprendre comment se déplacer et interagir avec l’environnement en utilisant les portails de manière créative. La notion de 3D est extrêmement bien exploitée, et ça change des jeux de puzzle traditionnels où vous devez simplement manipuler des objets dans un espace plat. C’est à la fois simple et brillant, ce qui en fait un excellent exercice de réflexion. Et croyez-moi, vous allez avoir le cerveau en ébullition pendant un bon moment !

Mais Portal n'est pas seulement un jeu de réflexion. Son ambiance décalée et sa narration subtile sont tout aussi marquantes. GLaDOS, l'intelligence artificielle qui vous guide à travers les tests, est un personnage mémorable (et légèrement flippante, il faut le dire), avec des répliques pleines d'humour noir. La tension monte tout au long du jeu, jusqu'à la fin où l’on se dit "comment ai-je bien pu ne pas voir ça venir ?" – tout en étant un peu dégoûté par la réalité de ce laboratoire absurde.

Niveau graphismes, Portal n’a rien de particulièrement révolutionnaire, mais il fait son job. L’esthétique de l’installation de test est minimaliste, voire froide, ce qui colle parfaitement à l’ambiance de laboratoire de science expérimentale. Pas de fioritures, juste l’essentiel pour faire passer le message- ^^

[quote]8.5/10[/quote]

184368682.review: I'm sure this review will get buried under thousands of similar reviews, but, genuinely, this is one of the greatest games of all time. I had not played it when it initially came out almost 20 years ago and only recently gave it a chance. I have never been the brightest when it came to puzzle games but have recently been trying to play through some of the most popular games of all time to at least experience them and this game was on the list. It is now tied for my favorite video game series of all time (The other game series being kingdom hearts). The way the levels slowly add to the complexity, allowing the player to learn at a solid pace is masterfully done. I also began learning to speedrun Portal because I have always loved a challenge and the bhopping movement is very natural to me because of my time spent on CS:GO. Another aspect I loved was the way the story telling is not in your face through cutscenes like in JRPGS like Kingdom Hearts. Instead, you play through the game and the set design tells the story in a more subtle manner. It makes me want to find other games that tell their stories in a similar way and play through those as well. Genuinely a great experience and worth the money.

184251001.review:
Portal is a game that redefined puzzle-platforming with its ingenious mechanics, sharp writing, and minimalist elegance. Released as part of The Orange Box by Valve, it’s a perfect example of how a short, focused experience can leave a lasting impact.

At the heart of Portal is its iconic gameplay mechanic: the portal gun. This device allows players to create linked portals on surfaces, enabling a whole new way to think about movement and problem-solving. The game’s design is masterful, introducing you to its mechanics with simple puzzles and gradually ramping up the complexity. By the end, you’re solving challenges that feel impossible at first glance, only to realize the solution was always there, waiting for you to see it.

The environment, the sterile, clinical test chambers of Aperture Science, may seem stark at first, but they’re brimming with personality. Every element serves a purpose, creating puzzles that feel cohesive and intuitive. The way the game teaches you its rules without ever resorting to heavy tutorials is a triumph of design.

But what truly elevates Portal is its narrative and tone. GLaDOS, the game’s antagonist and your guide through the test chambers, is an unforgettable character. Her passive-aggressive humor, thinly veiled threats, and increasingly unhinged behavior make her one of gaming’s most iconic villains. Her voice lines are endlessly quotable, and the humor strikes a perfect balance between absurdity and menace.

The story unfolds subtly at first, with cryptic hints that all is not as it seems in Aperture Science. As you progress, the layers of mystery peel back, culminating in a thrilling escape and a legendary final boss fight. And of course, who could forget the unforgettable song, Still Alive, which plays during the credits? It’s a perfect capstone to the game’s wit and charm.

While Portal is a relatively short experience, that brevity is part of its brilliance. There’s no filler, no wasted moments, every puzzle, every line of dialogue serves the experience.

In just a few hours, Portal leaves a lasting impression as one of the smartest, funniest, and most well-crafted games ever made. Whether you’re a fan of puzzles, great storytelling, or innovative game design, Portal is an absolute must-play and a cornerstone of modern gaming history.

184244610.review:
[b]Portal[/b] to naprawdę fajna i relaksująca gra, która nie tylko zmusza człowieka do myślenia, podczas przechodzenia coraz to kolejnych pokoi, w których trzeba rozwiązywać różnego rodzaju zagadki, ale też daje swego rodzaju swobodę podczas przechodzenia ich. Fabuła potrafi rozbawić gracza i nie jest zbyt skomplikowana. Sterujemy kobietą o imieniu Chell, która budzi się w placówce Enrichment Center, należącej do korporacji Aperture Science. Ma ona w niej za zadanie przejść przez pokoje z zagadkami, czyli tak zwane komory testowe, których rozwiązanie gwarantuje nam przejście do następnej komory. Po przejściu ich wszystkich, jako wynagrodzenie jest nam obiecane ciasto. W [b]Portalu[/b] najbardziej podoba mi się to uczucie wolności i swobody podczas grania. Nie czułem się przymuszony do wykonywania konkretnych poleceń. Miałem za zadanie rozwiązać zagadkę, a to w jaki sposób to zrobiłem zależało tylko ode mnie. Nie ma jednego słusznego rozwiązania i jakichkolwiek kar za użycie tego niekonwencjonalnego. Wydaje mi się, że twórcy chcieli chyba przetestować kreatywność graczy lub w większym bądź mniejszym stopniu ją też rozwinąć i to mi się podoba.

Po przejściu wątku fabularnego można rozpocząć od przechodzenia Wyzwań. Tam natomiast jesteśmy wręcz zmuszeni do rozwiązywania zagadek w mniej konwencjonalny sposób. Wyzwania dzielą się na trzy kategorie. Czyli przejście poziomu w jak najkrótszym czasie, albo z najmniejszą liczbą kroków lub portali. Żeby to zrobić trzeba trochę wysilić umysł. Wyzwanie czasowe polecam wybrać jako ostatnie. Do tego dochodzą jeszcze Pomieszczenia zaawansowane, w których poziom trudności został odrobinę zwiększony. Otoczenie ulega zmianie, wieżyczki są nie do ruszenia, przedmiot który musimy tachać ze sobą jest inny itd. [b]Portal[/b] jest grą na nie całe 5 godzin, przez co po ukończeniu gry można czuć lekki niedosyt. Widać, że Valve tworząc te niewielką produkcję nie oczekiwali, aż tak pozytywnego odbioru od strony graczy, inaczej gra byłaby dłuższa i trochę większa, a to zmotywowało ich do stworzenia drugiej części. SZKODA, ŻE K*RWA NIE TRZECIEJ!

A tak przy okazji jeśli ktoś chcę pograć w tą świetną produkcję i chciałby ją zobaczyć w odświeżonej grafice to od tego jest [b]Portal with RTX[/b]. Niestety nie da się w niego normalnie grać, z kartą AMD. Raz odpaliłem tego [b]Portala[/b] i z jakiegoś powodu nie mogę go ponownie włączyć, na szczęście ten dodatek jest darmowy więc nie mam nad czym ubolewać, no może poza grafiką. Oczywiście [b]Portal with RTX[/b] jest traktowany jako osobna gra, to oznacza, że wszystkie osiągnięcia jakie zdobyliście w oryginalnej wersji nie zapiszą się w wersji z RTX, co moim zdaniem wychodzi na plus.

184229318.review: this is such a good game

184229041.review:
No exagero al decir que Portal cambió mi vida. No solo como jugadora, sino como persona. La ingeniosa mecánica de juego, la narrativa oscuramente humorística y la brillante escritura me dejaron completamente cautivada desde el primer momento. La sensación de satisfacción al resolver cada rompecabezas, la creciente sensación de inquietud ante la personalidad de GLaDOS, todo contribuyó a una experiencia inolvidable.
La innovación en el diseño de los puzzles es sencillamente brillante. Cada nuevo desafío te presenta un reto único, obligándote a pensar fuera de la caja (literalmente) y a utilizar tu ingenio para superar los obstáculos. La curva de dificultad está perfectamente equilibrada, ofreciendo un reto constante sin llegar a ser frustrante.
Más allá de la jugabilidad, la historia es lo que realmente eleva a Portal a un nivel superior. La relación entre el jugador y GLaDOS es tensa, hilarante y profundamente perturbadora. La manera en que la narrativa se desenvuelve a través de los propios puzzles y las breves interacciones con la IA es magistral. La escritura es ingeniosa, llena de sarcasmo y humor negro, lo que hace que la experiencia sea aún más memorable.
El juego es corto, sí, pero su impacto es inmenso. Cada minuto está perfectamente aprovechado, sin relleno ni momentos aburridos. Es una obra maestra de la concisión y la eficacia. Y aunque la historia concluye de manera satisfactoria, la sed de una tercera entrega es insaciable. Sueño con Portal 3, con nuevas pruebas, nuevos desafíos y más interacciones con GLaDOS. Daría mi vida por ello, sin dudarlo.
Portal es una experiencia única e imprescindible para cualquier amante de los videojuegos. Es un juego que te hará pensar, te hará reír, y te dejará con ganas de más. Una obra maestra que ha dejado una marca imborrable en mi corazón (y en mi mente). Si aún no lo has jugado, ¡hazlo ya! No te arrepentirás.

184096917.review:
Игры которые не хотят стареть
Много лет назад, когда я в первые поиграл в Portal, для меня это был, мне кажется, первый опыт в игру, которая заставляет думать, но при этом не является квестом или стратегией. И пусть задачи, Portal, ставит не адски  хардкорные, но при этом решать их все равно очень интересно. Сегодня я решил перепройти игру на Steam Deck и что я могу сказать:
1) Portal не постарела. Она все так же красива, интересна и по своему колоритная.
2) Пройти игру на Steam Deck была отличная идея, так как это вышел совершенно другой опыт - консольный так сказать.
Отдельной слезой ностальгии удостоились диалоги Glados и песня под титры...
Отдельным плюсом для меня стала длительность. Один вечерок что бы по полной кайфануть и получить при этом законченный опыт - это дорогое нынче удовольствие.

Игра все еще не постарела и прекрасно себя чувствует
Игра вышла на разные платформы, играйте как душе угодно
Все так же шикарные саундтрек и приятные головоломки
Короткая игра, самое то что бы скоротать 1-2 вечера
Тортик я так и не поел...

184038943.review:
Portal - культовая игра-головоломка от Вольво, вышедшая аж в 2007 году.

[h3]Сюжет:[/h3]
Вы будете играть за безымянную девушку, которая просыпается посреди небольшой камеры со стеклянными стенами. Проводится эксперимент, и Вы — подопытная. Вокруг висят камеры наблюдения, а ГЛэДОС - суперкомпьютер с искусственным интеллектом, будет единственным Вашим "спутником" на протяжении всей игры, который будет общаться с Вами, давать указания и рофлить.

[h3]Геймплей:[/h3]
Название игры отображает главную механику игры - порталы. У Вас есть пушка, создающая их (поначалу один, через некоторое время — два). Работает она так: стреляем на плоскость, открывается портал, стреляем на другую, и там тоже открывается портал. Заходим в один — выходим из другого.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3411161397 

На этом и будут построены все головомки. Но, помимо этого, в игре есть разные кнопки и кубы, с которыми можно взаимодействовать; лазеры и боевые роботы, которые могут убить Вас; различные механизмы и приспособления, которые также участвуют в головоломках.

[h3]Плюсы:[/h3]
1) Невероятно "хорошо постаревшая" графика: несмотря на то, что игра вышла в 2007 году, глаз она радует до сих пор, особенно порталы.

2) Инновационный геймплей для того времени.

2)  ИИ ГЛэДОС, а именно, её озвучка и рофлы. Её голос надолго запоминается: конечно не так, как актёр, озвучивший Артаса из WC3, но если Вы еще раз где-то услышите ее - ни с чем не спутаете. К тому же, она весь финальный файт рофлит, и даже может сказать, что Вы сирота (и не только), чего в современных играх не услышишь (ведь сейчас, по мнению разрабов, все такие неженки).

4) Лор связан с вселенной Half-Life - фанаты ликуют.

5) После основного сюжета можно пройти различные испытания и парочку усложненных карт.

[h3]Минусы:[/h3]
1) К сожалению, наша испытуемая все время молчит - для кого-то это может быть минус.

2) Игра достаточно короткая, я пришел её за 2 часа.

3) Из 16 карт (миссий) только на 1 был затуп, т.е. игра достаточно легкая. Может мне так показалось, потому что я уже проходил Portal 2, и возможно у тех, кто не знаком с этой серией игр, будут какие-то трудности.

4) В отличии от второй части, тут нет кооператива.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3411162104  

[h1]Итоговая оценка - 9/10[/h1]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3411162206

184038624.review: I've bought this game in the Companion Collection for Nintendo Switch as well as the "Still Alive" version for Xbox 360.  This game, of course, is the same thing, great and good fun.  This version is probably my favorite, being installable on anything with decent storage, and a couple gigabytes of ram and such.  It doesn't end there, obviously this version can be modded, messed around with, and don't forget my favorite, cheats!  I love spawning airboats and setting my impulse to 101 so I can play the game like Half Life 2.  All in all, if you're in the market for Portal, buy this one if you're in for modding and shenanigans, and if not and you own a Switch, just get the companion collection.

183943401.review:
それなりに楽しめたのだけど「自分が求めていたものと違う！」となったので。
ガチガチのパズルゲームかと思っていたら、アクション多めの脱出ゲームという方が近いかな？
パズルとしての要素はあまり強くなく、パズルゲームとしては全くオススメしません。
初めからアクションゲームだと思ってやっていたらまた違った感想を持ったかもしれない。

プレイして非常に気になるのが、視点移動が非常に具合悪いこと。
例えば片方のポータルを壁、もう片方を床に設置し、
床の穴にダイブすると重力に従ってぐる～んと自動で回転するのだけど、その間自分がどういう状況なのか
全く理解できない状態になるのがプレイしていてフラストレーションが溜まる。
当然そういうアクションを強要される個所も多々あるが、
結局、最後までよく分からないままなぁなぁでクリアしてしまった。

ゲーム前半は、ゲームが進むにつれ「やりたいことはちょっと考えるとだいたいわかるが、それを実現するのが難しい」という状況が増え、方法の試行錯誤ではなく、操作の最適化をさせられる時間が長くなる。
結果、苦労して上手くいっても納得感は無く「やっと作業が終わった」という感想が先に来てしまう。
後半になると、パズル要素はほぼ消え、ポータルを駆使してひたすら先への道を探して進むことになる。
おそらく設定上は「テストルームの舞台裏をくぐり抜ける」みたいな感じだと思うのだけど
道がわかりにくい上、プレス機やら即死足場など、なんでこんなものがここにあるのか説明が全くつかないような場所を
延々と超えていく。ぶっちゃけ、ほぼ面倒臭さとストレスしかなかった。

ゲームの全体像を見ると、空間を自由につなげて、それをパズルとして成り立たせているのは凄いと思う。
ポータルの向こう側に自分の姿が見えたり等、独特の雰囲気を感じられるゲームなので
「ちょっと変わったゲームがやりたいな」という人には良いかもしれません。

Portal é um jogo clássico e muito importante, não só para videogames e sua industria, mas também para grande parte das mídias de entretenimento roteirizadas que temos hoje em dia. Muito além do aspecto de gameplay e resolução de enigmas dentro do jogo, a narrativa construída lentamente por de baixo dos panos é genialmente criada para te surpreender e te chocar no final do jogo, outros elementos importantes e icônicos como a própria portal gun que se tornou parte da cultura da internet e eu posso dizer com quase 100% de certeza que a maioria das pessoas que acessam a internet já viram pelo menos uma foto da arma. 
Os gráficos do jogo são muito bonnitos até os dias de hoje, mesmo jogando na versão sem rtx, sem contar nas musicas e com a resolução dos puzzles que agradam muito, recomendo bastante a compra desse clássico.

183895854.review:
Review: Portal

Não sei nem por onde começar a falar desse jogo, mas vou tentar. Portal é uma experiência tão única que, assim que você começa, não dá pra parar. Cada puzzle que você resolve te dá uma sensação de recompensa tão boa que, quando percebe, já chegou no final. Foi exatamente o que aconteceu comigo: zerei em uma única play, de tão envolvido que fiquei.

O jogo usa a Source Engine, a mesma de Half-Life 2 e Team Fortress 2. Mesmo com os gráficos mais antigos, o visual funciona muito bem. Os cenários são simples, mas foram feitos de um jeito que aumenta a tensão e aquele sentimento de solidão. Conforme você avança, encontra sinais de que outras pessoas passaram por ali, mas nunca chega a ver ninguém. Isso, combinado com a protagonista que não fala e a presença constante da GLaDOS, deixa tudo ainda mais estranho e te faz pensar: “O que merda tá acontecendo aqui?”

Lore (Sem Spoilers)

Portal acontece no mesmo universo de Half-Life, mas tem uma pegada diferente. Você joga como Chell, uma pessoa “aleatória” que foi jogada nos testes malucos da Aperture Science, uma empresa que rivaliza com a Black Mesa. Usando a Portal Gun, você precisa resolver uma série de puzzles enquanto tenta entender o que tá rolando. O jogo não entrega tudo de bandeja, mas se você prestar atenção nos detalhes e explorar, vai encontrar várias pistas que deixam as coisas ainda mais interessantes.

Jogabilidade

Uma coisa que me impressionou foi como o jogo vai te ensinando as mecânicas sem nunca te jogar na cara algo impossível. No começo, os puzzles são bem tranquilos, mas logo começam a exigir mais atenção e criatividade. É um daqueles jogos que te desafia na medida certa: você quebra a cabeça, mas quando resolve, sente que foi tudo mérito seu.

Vale a pena?

Com certeza. Portal é curto, mas é uma daquelas experiências que ficam na memória. É divertido, inteligente e tem um humor ácido que deixa tudo ainda melhor. Se você gosta de puzzles ou só quer jogar algo diferente, não tem como errar com esse aqui.

NOTA FINAL: 9/10
E só pra lembrar: The cake is a lie!

183882208.review:
Portal is still brilliant in 2024. Its aesthetically interesting, with an appropriate OST to boot. The puzzles are easy enough, although I can see how some people would struggle, and it also adds depth to the world of Half-Life whilst also contextualising Aperture Science and their goals in Portal's narrative, and of course, GladOS is a pretty fun villain and makes for some good comedic relief throughout. 

My biggest gripe with the game is just that it's so short, it's so brilliant and I just wanted more of it, but I managed to beat the whole game in about 2 hours. I understand there is workshop content, but I just want to focus on the merit of the game as it is, not community content. Ultimately, this seems more like a proof of concept that would later take shape in Portal 2.

8/10, more content would easily make this a 9 or even 10, but I'm still very happy with the game as it is.

183714917.review:
[h3] 体験したことの無いパズルゲーム [/h3]
易しいとか難しいとかでは無く、「こんなパズルがあるんだ」と感心させられるゲームです。
最初は戸惑うかもしれないですが、ルールが分かってきたときに新鮮な感覚が味わえます。


[h3] 激しい３D酔いと蛇足なアクション性 [/h3]
本作は一人称視点で、また、パズルの都合上いろいろ見上げたり見下ろしたり見回したりの視点移動が忙しいです。
このため、地球の重力下にお住まいの方は必ず酔うと思われます。
この３D酔いを加速させる一因として、視点移動や注視が必要なアクションを求められることが挙げられます。

アクションもしくは３D酔いに耐性が無い方はさわりの部分だけプレイしてほしいです。
前述した”新鮮さ”を感じられれば充分このゲームの楽しい部分は味わえたといえると思います。


[h3] セールだとかなり安い [/h3]
上記２点を踏まえ、セール時に気軽に購入してみることを推奨します。

183648136.review:
Portal is a critically acclaimed dark puzzle humor simulator developed by Valve based on an old college student project named Narbacular Drop. Started as a project from students at the DigiPen Institute of Technology, Narbacular Drop itself was game whose entire premise involves a princess named No-Knees (on the account that she literally can’t jump) and her journey in escaping a dungeon after being captured by a demon by placing interconnected portals around the dungeon in order to solve puzzles. Picked up by Valve after finding it at the DigiPen career fair and proceeded to hire them all on after being thoroughly impressed by Narbacular Drop, hoping to create a spiritual successor from a team of less than a dozen people. Tying it into the Half-Life universe due to the easy excuse of reusing assets from Half-Life 2, which “made sense” and “Some of that was driven by the fact that we didn't have a big enough team to do the art from scratch, so we ended up reusing primarily Half-Life 2 art assets” according to Erik Wolpaw in a Game Informer article about the development about the game. They would also work with Half-Life writer Marc Laidlaw on tying it into the Half-Life universe, though this concept would make him a bit uncomfortable as according to a RockPaperShotgun article, he felt it made “both universes smaller” before accepting it, saying “I just had to react as gracefully as I could to the fact that it was going there without me. It didn’t make any sense except from a resource-restricted point of view.” While this would have potentially greater consequences for the Half-Life universe down the line (in cancelled Half-Life 2: Episode 3 pitches); Portal itself would have some cut content including a brick joke of a “Party Escort Bot” shadowing you around the second half of the game, walking turrets, a cut character named “The Rat Man” (however put in as little easter eggs along with a later ARG for it’s sequel), an original Combine-style Design like Half-Life 2, and even a different portal gun in the style of the Gravity Gun. Overall though, development would remain smooth for the most part to create one of the most critically acclaimed titles of all time! As for my experience with Portal? I followed all the top ten video guys like ScrewAttack and first learned of it from there before being able to play it myself through The Orange Box, along with following all of the memes like “The Cake is a Lie” as a kid of course. I had picked it up myself along with the rest of the Half-Life collection on Steam and had played it all the way to the end, though apparently I forgot to actually BEAT the game until recently due to exploring the final area with NoClip and such. Finishing it off technically recently, I decided that now was as good as ever to write up a review for Portal right around Christmas time so why not.

(For Plot, Atmosphere, Graphics, Sound Design/links go here: https://www.backloggd.com/u/gamemast15r/review/2227324/)

The gameplay for Portal centers around the concept of shooting two portals (one orange and one blue) around an arena in order to solve physics based puzzles whilst also dealing with hazards like toxic water, being crushed to death or perhaps shot by turrets to name a few (though thankfully not fall damage). Straight out of the gate, while I don’t really care for puzzles much due to the fact that I suck at them, I appreciate the work that goes into them and the physics around it. One of the funniest things to me is shooting a portal above and below me and just falling down in an infinite loop, which is sometimes what’s needed in order to make huge jumps due to speed by shooting another portal on a different platform to launch yourself across a gap. The puzzles of course get more difficult as they go along, and while admittedly I used walkthroughs to get through some of the later ones, I can at least say that most of the time for me it always felt fair and awe inspiring on how to actually complete said puzzles. I don’t really feel like there’s much to explain on this end other than I feel like Valve’s way of pushing the narrative while also explaining the puzzle mechanics of the game. It works fantastic, it feels fantastic and it LOOKS fantastic on top of it! The atmosphere for this game is this mixture of lighthearted black comedy and honestly oppressiveness due to being locked up in walled-up test chambers, but the former heavily outweighs the latter. Between GlaDOS’s explanation of scientific terminology, to dangling the prospect of cake in front of your face, to taunting you with cake AND murder all while dangling it in the monotone voice (provided by Ellen McLain, the only other voice actor than apparently Mike Patton who does the Anger Sphere). 

I feel like most people who have any interest in video games in pop culture know of Portal and how critically acclaimed AND successful it was. Memes like “The Cake is a Lie” would perpetuate within meme circles of young gamers (like me and my buddies as a kid) while GlaDOS and the Companion Cube would become popular mascots. Portal would go on to sell a lot of copies too, becoming so successful that it was even paired in The Orange Box with Half Life 2/Episodes and Team Fortress 2 via Xbox 360 (where I first played it) and PS3. They would also release the game again exclusively on the Xbox Live Arcade which featured new challenges and achievements along with being ported to the Nintendo Switch’s Portal: Companion Collection along with Portal OG and Portal 2. Yes of course the very obvious Portal 2 would be announced and later released, with work on it being developed concurrently with Left 4 Dead (with overlapping employees) and a cool alternate reality game being added in to help promote it. A movie was planned by J.J. Abrahms but like lots of mystery box creations of his, the movie has yet to come to a satisfying fruition. Most importantly (for me at least), the game’s modding community would help keep this personality filled game alive, some of these mods I have played and completed casually. As for me personally, while Portal isn’t really one of my favorite games of all time (due to my sucking at puzzles and affinity for more dark and violent games), it’s certainly one of the games that I respect the most out of all of them. Truth be told, I feel like every gamer who invests themselves in the gaming lexicon should try this puzzle shooter AT LEAST once in their life, even if they need a walkthrough (admittedly like me) to do it. It’s a fun-filled experience, made me giggle once or twice, and opened up a decent bit of nostalgia for me. Soon I plan on playing Portal 2, though how soon I don’t know as I want to do the base game AND the co-op stuff.

183607810.review:
You play as a hungry lady looking for a cake after being asleep for like 250 years (or so).

To achieve such objective, this robot lady guides our protagonist named Chell through test chambers, which slowly get more and more deadly as you advance, making it a show for the robot lady watching you.

On some chambers, you will see robot turrets being slaves of this robot lady, being forced to shoot you as they see you and not  blaming you for shutting them down, giving you a clear sign that the robot lady is evil.

10/10

183576303.review: Классная игра для тех кто родился в 2000-х годах, всем "скуфам" привет, но если вы любите играть в такие игры, то советую мозги не ебать и купить орандж бокс и там будут все олдовские игры, это то время, когда не было войны с украинцами, мир казался по другому, когда доллар стоил 28.35₽, когда олимпийские игры проходили не в говняной речке, с толпой гееев, когда еще не было такого, что у всех были механические клавиатуры, когда только только начал появляться ютюб, вот это было конечно время, мне лично в то время казалось, что мир тогда выглядел как будто через "розовые очки", была оригинальная кола из РФ, в России можно было пополнять карту стим практически без комиссии, любимое время, жаль я его не застал в 20 лет, и со своим багажом знаний, когда винда была 7 и ее можно было скачать без ебанной ошибки, короче ребят, покупайте, годная игра даже для 2025 года.

183555670.review:
Portal is a fun game that takes the physics idea present in Half Life 2 and amps it up to be a full on puzzle game.

The puzzles are satisfying to figure out, and overall the game never felt too hard, nor too easy.

If I had a complain, I guess it’s a little short? It makes it replayable, but I wish the game had a little more meat on its bones.

8.5/10

183535380.review: Como pode um jogo de 2007 ser tão antigo e, ao mesmo tempo, tão atual? Entre todos os jogos, este consegue oferecer uma experiência única e inesquecível, tanto pela sua história quanto pelo gameplay. 183533477.review: For a smaller game, it will keep you entertained for the whole ride. The portal puzzles themselves are quite simple in nature, but the fun is in the challenges you can place on them to add just a little more depth to each level. The story is great with wonderful atmospheric storytelling which will keep you on the lookout in every nook and cranny. It is well worth the price and the enjoyment is worth much more. I would highly recommend it to everyone, even someone with no gaming experience at all.
